subsc: Other industry,Sewerage,Water supply,Roads and highways,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Infrastructure Engineering Project
            in Lesotho was achieved. The Bank's performance was
            somewhat unsatisfactory in the identification phase,
            satisfactory in the preparation and appraisal phases, and
            highly successful during the three years of implementation.
            The Borrower's performance was satisfactory in project
            identification, preparation, appraisal, and covenant
            compliance. The Borrower's performance during project
            implementation was also satisfactory although there were
            some weaknesses in project coordination. All initially
            planned studies were completed and procedures for allocating
            available funds for investment and maintenance in line with
            economic criteria were developed. The key lesson learned
            from the implementation of the project are: In order to
            ensure the quality of studies and the efficiency of
            training, activities must take place within a comprehensive
            manpower development strategy, and trained staff must be
            evaluated through an agreed upon mechanism.
